cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to turn northeast across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Louisiana coast in the vicinity of Intracoastal City/Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City, Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida border including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama, with impacts spreading inland across the Southeast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with possible gusts 25–35 mph as remnants pass nearby early next week
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Tuesday, leading to minor urban or poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated thunderstorms; very low tornado threat
